intro: Miconia mesmeana subsp. jobonensis, commonly known as the Jobonensis Miconia, is a tropical shrub native to the Caribbean, particularly found in the Lesser Antilles. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in diameter. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by bright red, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forests and moist lowland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
